en.assertion: Thin glomerular basement membrane (benign familial hematuria)
en.reason:
Autosomal dominant
! Incidence in healthy population 5-9-10%
Diagnosis by EM: thin (<264 nm) GBM
Clinical manifestations:
Persistent microhematuria
No progression = good prognosis
Familial hematuria
Differential diagnosis: 
Early changes in Alport sindrome
Carrier state of Alport gene (in women)
